Test Case Description: Checking EMS MIL TT functionality in Urban Mode(Day Mode) while vehicle is moving
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
1. Navigate to Menu -> Display Setup -> Light and Dark Mode and Select Light mode
1a. Display is set to Light mode
2. Navigate to Menu -> Ride Mode and Select Urban mode
2a. Ride Mode is set to Urban mode
3.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = 3 and ACC_PEDAL_IP  30 %  to  achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 50kmph 
3a. Vehicle shall be moving at 50 kmph in 3rd gear:
ENGINE_DATA_1.GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =    7 
ABS_DATA_3(0x450): WHEEL_SPEED_FRONT = 50 
ABS_DATA_3(0x450: WHEEL_SPEED_REAR = 50
4. Set conditions such that no EMS malfunction exists using below CAN signal 
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 0
4a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF
5. Simulate EMS malfuntion through below CAN Signal
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 1
5a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
6. Stop the EMS Malfuntion through below CAN Signal
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 0
6a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF
Post Condition:
1. Click on Menu->Trip details->Select "Reset"-> select "Yes"
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V

Test Case Description: Checking the impact of EMS Malfunction in system under Urban Mode
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
1. Navigate to Menu -> Ride Mode and Select Urban mode
1a. Ride Mode is set to Urban mode
2. Simulate EMS malfuntion through below CAN Signal
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 1 
2a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color) 
3. Try to change the ride mode to Rain, Tour & Enduro mode
3a. You shall not be able to change the ride mode
4. Stop the EMS Malfuntion through below CAN Signal
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 0
4a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF
5. Try again to change the ride mode to Rain, Tour & Enduro mode
5a. You shall be able to change to any ride mode with message on cluster- "Ride Mode Change Not Possible"

Pre-Action: 1. Set voltage to 13.5V
Test Steps.Action:
1. IGN is set to OFF using below control switch
Ignition_SW_IP = 0 (OFF)
1a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF

Test Case Description: Checking the EMS MIL TT status in system with CAN Fault Conditions
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
Create CAN Bus OFF fault by shorting the CAN lines to Gnd CAN H and CAN L lines
1.Create CAN Short
1a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
2. Remove fault.
2a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF

Test Case Description: Checking the EMS MIL TT status in system with CAN Fault Conditions
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
Create CAN Bus OFF fault by shorting the CAN lines to Gnd CAN H and CAN L lines
1.Create Short to Gnd CANH
1a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
2.Remove fault.
2a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF
3.Create Short to Gnd CANL
3a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
4.Remove fault.
4a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF

Test Case Description: Checking the EMS MIL TT status in system with CAN Fault Conditions
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
Create CAN Bus OFF fault by shorting the CAN lines to Gnd CAN H and CAN L lines
1.Create open Ckt at CANH
1a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
2.Remove fault
2a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF.
3.Create open Ckt at CANH
3a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
4.Remove fault.
4a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF

Test Case Description: Checking the impact of under voltage(LVSD) condition on EMS MIL TT in system
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
1. Simulate EMS malfuntion through below CAN Signal 
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 1
1a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
2. Set the battery voltage to 7.9 V and wait 2 seconds
2a. Cluster will shutdown & EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF
3. Set the battery voltage to 13.5V and wait 2 seconds
3a. Cluster will turn ON & once the self check completes, EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)

Test Case Description: Checking the impact of over voltage(HVSD2) condition on EMS MIL TT in system
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
1. Simulate EMS malfuntion through below CAN Signal 
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 1
1a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
2. Set the battery voltage to 18.1V and wait 2 seconds
2a. Cluster will shutdown & EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF
3. Set the battery voltage to 13.5V and wait 2 seconds
3a. Cluster will turn ON & once the self check completes, EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)

Test Case Description: Checking the status EMS MIL TT update through change of values on CAN input during IGN cycle transition
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
1. Set conditions such that no EMS malfunction exists using below CAN signal 
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 0
1a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be OFF
2. IGN is set to OFF using below control switch
Ignition_SW_IP = 0
2a. Cluster will shutdown
3. Simulate EMS malfuntion through below CAN Signal 
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 1
4. Turn Ignition ON.[4gnition_SW_IP= 1]
4a. Cluster will turn ON & once the self check completes, EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)

Test Case Description: Checking the EMS MIL TT functionality status in system with battery disconnection & reconnection conditions
Pre-Action:
1. Set Battery Voltage to 13.5V
2. Turn Ignition ON.[Ignition_SW_IP= 1]
3. Crank the vehicle[ES_SW_IP=1]
4. No CAN failure & MIL failure should not be present
5.Simulate Gear_Position_Sensor_IP = Neutral [GEAR_POSITION[0x150] =  0x2]
6.Simulate ACC_PEDAL_IP = 0% to achieve DISPLAY_SPEED[0x120] = 0kmph
Test Steps.Action:
1. Simulate EMS malfuntion through below CAN Signal 
ENGINE_DATA_2 (0X350).MIL_STATUS = 1
1a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
2. Disconnect the battery from cluster
2a. EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
3. Reconnect the battery to cluster
3a. Cluster will turn ON & once the self check completes, EMS MIL Telltale shall be ON(Glowing in Amber color)
